roleset.name: survey, as of voters

example.name: poll-v: without topic
example.text: The consensus of economists polled by Dow Jones Capital Markets Report calls for a 2.5 % annual growth rate for GNP during the quarter .

propbank.arg: by Dow Jones Capital Markets Report

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: For the first time , the October survey polled members on imports .

example.name: poll-n: arg1 as a region
example.text: In the Suffolk poll for Wednesday , it was Romney 43 % and Santorum 6 % .

example.name: poll-n: Args 0, 1
example.text: However , their poll of Apathetic people is too close to call , as is the poll of unregistered , non voters .

example.name: NOT EVENTIVE. .YY!
example.text: Anything which makes voting more difficult they figure will reduce the number of voters going to the polls to vote for Democrats .

example.name: poll-n: arg2
example.text: Now the Tories are facing the unpopularity of government and Labour are ahead on the opinion polls .

roleset.note: POLL-V NOTES: No relevant VN class. (from poll.01-v)
POLL-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, WordNet, poll-v.01. No VNcls. (from poll.01-n)
Watch out for instances that refer to physical voting locations. These are not events, and should be labelled .YY. (from poll.01-n)
